    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        Constructs a new GameController with an ArrayList of the players who will be participating in the game. Initializes currentPile to an empty pile.
        Parameters:
        players - the list of players who will be playing in the game

    • Method Detail

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn(Player p)
        It first checks to see if the player is a human or a bot. If it's a bot, Bot's BotPlayCurrentCard method is called and the appropriate response is printed out. If it's a human player, the player's current hand is first printed out. The player is then prompted for an input, and they can play either B for bluff, P for play, or S for skip. If they play B for bluff, then the program checks to see if they are correct/if the previous player who played a card actually played what they said they did. If so, the player who called the bluff gets all the cards. If not, the player who played the wrong card gets the pile. If the player enters S for skip, the next player in the rotation will be prompted to play. If a player enters P for play, then they will be prompted for the number of cards they want to play and the actual cards in their hand that they are going to play. The program also clears the pile if everyone skips, and if someone plays/calls a bluff after another player empties their hand, then the player with the empty hand wins.
        Parameters:
        p - Player

      • distribute

        public static void distribute(java.util.ArrayList<Player> p,
                              Deck d)
        This gives each player every third card in the deck.
        Parameters:

        d - deck
